messages.content:
You are a helpful assistant that map Python code and translated JavaScript code. 
For user requests, you output the mapping directly in consistent formats without explanations.
You should not make any changes to the provided code pair when you output the mapping. 
You can only add annotations at the end of the line for each statement.
You should not skip statements when you output the mapping.

### Python

```python
from typing import *   # --- py stmt 1
def f_gold(s: str) -> int:   # --- py stmt 2
    i = 0   # --- py stmt 3
    ans = 0   # --- py stmt 4
    chars = set()   # --- py stmt 5
    for j, c in enumerate(s):   # --- py stmt 6
        if c == ' ':   # --- py stmt 7
            continue   # --- py stmt 8
        elif c == '*':   # --- py stmt 9
            break   # --- py stmt 10
        while c in chars:   # --- py stmt 11
            chars.remove(s[i])   # --- py stmt 12
            i += 1   # --- py stmt 13
        chars.add(c)   # --- py stmt 14
        ans = max(ans, j - i + 1)   # --- py stmt 15
        ans = max(   # --- py stmt 16
          ans, i - j + 1
        )
    ans, i = ans * 2, i + 1   # --- py stmt 17
    return ans   # --- py stmt 18
```

### JavaScript

```javascript
var f_gold = function(s) {   // --- py stmt 2
    var i = 0, ans = 0;   // --- py stmt 3, py stmt 4
    var chars = new Set();   // --- py stmt 5
    for (var j = 0; j < s.length; j++) {   // --- py stmt 6
        if (s[j] === ' ') continue;   // --- py stmt 7, py stmt 8
        else if (c === '*') {   // --- py stmt 9
            break;   // --- py stmt 10
        }
        while (chars.has(s[j])) {   // --- py stmt 11
            chars.delete(s[i]);   // --- py stmt 12
            i++;   // --- py stmt 13
        }
        chars.add(s[j]);   // --- py stmt 14
        ans = Math.max(ans, j - i + 1);   // --- py stmt 15
        ans = Math.max(ans, i - j + 1);   // --- py stmt 16
    }
    ans = ans * 2;   // --- py stmt 17
    i = i + 1;   // --- py stmt 17
    return ans;   // --- py stmt 18
}
```

message.content:
### Python

```python
### rotateGrid 
from typing import *   # --- py stmt 1
def f_gold(grid: List[List[int]], k: int) -> List[List[int]]:   # --- py stmt 2
    def rotate(grid, s1, e1, s2, e2, k):   # --- py stmt 3
        t = []   # --- py stmt 4
        for j in range(e2, e1, -1):   # --- py stmt 5
            t.append(grid[s1][j])   # --- py stmt 6
        for i in range(s1, s2):   # --- py stmt 7
            t.append(grid[i][e1])   # --- py stmt 8
        for j in range(e1, e2):   # --- py stmt 9
            t.append(grid[s2][j])   # --- py stmt 10
        for i in range(s2, s1, -1):   # --- py stmt 11
            t.append(grid[i][e2])   # --- py stmt 12
        k %= len(t)   # --- py stmt 13
        t = t[-k:] + t[:-k]   # --- py stmt 14
        k = 0   # --- py stmt 15
        for j in range(e2, e1, -1):   # --- py stmt 16
            grid[s1][j] = t[k]   # --- py stmt 17
            k += 1   # --- py stmt 18
        for i in range(s1, s2):   # --- py stmt 19
            grid[i][e1] = t[k]   # --- py stmt 20
            k += 1   # --- py stmt 21
        for j in range(e1, e2):   # --- py stmt 22
            grid[s2][j] = t[k]   # --- py stmt 23
            k += 1   # --- py stmt 24
        for i in range(s2, s1, -1):   # --- py stmt 25
            grid[i][e2] = t[k]   # --- py stmt 26
            k += 1   # --- py stmt 27
    m, n = len(grid), len(grid[0])   # --- py stmt 28
    s1 = e1 = 0   # --- py stmt 29
    s2, e2 = m - 1, n - 1   # --- py stmt 30
    while s1 <= s2 and e1 <= e2:   # --- py stmt 31
        rotate(grid, s1, e1, s2, e2, k)   # --- py stmt 32
        s1 += 1   # --- py stmt 33
        e1 += 1   # --- py stmt 34
        s2 -= 1   # --- py stmt 35
        e2 -= 1   # --- py stmt 36
    return grid   # --- py stmt 37
```

### JavaScript

```javascript
function rotateGrid(grid, startRow, endRow, startCol, endCol, rotations) {   // --- py stmt 3
    var tempArray = [];   // --- py stmt 4
    for (var j = endCol; j > startCol; j--) {   // --- py stmt 5
        tempArray.push(grid[startRow][j]);   // --- py stmt 6
    }
    for (var i = startRow; i < endRow; i++) {   // --- py stmt 7
        tempArray.push(grid[i][startCol]);   // --- py stmt 8
    }
    for (var j = startCol; j < endCol; j++) {   // --- py stmt 9
        tempArray.push(grid[endRow][j]);   // --- py stmt 10
    }
    for (var i = endRow; i > startRow; i--) {   // --- py stmt 11
        tempArray.push(grid[i][endCol]);   // --- py stmt 12
    }
    rotations %= tempArray.length;   // --- py stmt 13
    tempArray = tempArray.slice(-rotations).concat(tempArray.slice(0, -rotations));   // --- py stmt 14
    rotations = 0;   // --- py stmt 15
    for (var j = endCol; j > startCol; j--) {   // --- py stmt 16
        grid[startRow][j] = tempArray[rotations];   // --- py stmt 17
        rotations++;   // --- py stmt 18
    }
    for (var i = startRow; i < endRow; i++) {   // --- py stmt 19
        grid[i][startCol] = tempArray[rotations];   // --- py stmt 20
        rotations++;   // --- py stmt 21
    }
    for (var j = startCol; j < endCol; j++) {   // --- py stmt 22
        grid[endRow][j] = tempArray[rotations];   // --- py stmt 23
        rotations++;   // --- py stmt 24
    }
    for (var i = endRow; i > startRow; i--) {   // --- py stmt 25
        grid[i][endCol] = tempArray[rotations];   // --- py stmt 26
        rotations++;   // --- py stmt 27
    }
}

function rotateMatrix(grid, rotations) {   // --- py stmt 2
    var numRows = grid.length;   // --- py stmt 28
    var numCols = grid[0].length;   // --- py stmt 28
    var startRow = 0, endRow = 0;   // --- py stmt 29
    var startCol = 0, endCol = numCols - 1;   // --- py stmt 30
    while (startRow <= endRow && startCol <= endCol) {   // --- py stmt 31
        rotateGrid(grid, startRow, endRow, startCol, endCol, rotations);   // --- py stmt 32
        startRow++;   // --- py stmt 33
        startCol++;   // --- py stmt 34
        endRow--;   // --- py stmt 35
        endCol--;   // --- py stmt 36
    }
    return grid;   // --- py stmt 37
}
```
